title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development designates military installations selected for closure or realignment as enterprise zones under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. These zones include the local community where the installation is located. Additionally, the Secretary designates them as redevelopment areas under the Public Works Act. Each military installation selected for closure or realignment is designated as a redevelopment area by the Secretary of Commerce for the purposes of the Public Works Act. The designated area includes the local community where the installation is located. The designations of a military installation as an enterprise zone and a redevelopment area must be made within 60 days of the installation being recommended for closure or realignment in a base closure report. The military installations selected for closure or realignment must be designated as enterprise zones within 60 days of the enactment of the Act. These designated zones are in addition to the 100 enterprise zones authorized under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. The enterprise zones designated under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 may receive funding for economic adjustment or community planning assistance from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or the Secretary of Commerce in connection with military base closures or realignments. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area remains valid for 5 years. The Secretary of Commerce will review the area annually and may terminate or modify the designation if it no longer meets the requirements. The term "base closure law" refers to the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 and title II of the Defense Authorization Amendments and Base Closure and Realignment Act. "Substantial realignment" is defined as a reduction in military installation operations affecting 50% or more of personnel. "Substantial realignment involves reassigning or transferring 50% or more of personnel at a military installation, including civilian employees and Armed Forces members." Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certain certifications are made to Congress. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to limit the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until specific certifications are provided to Congress.
